remarks: For any element other than 1, there is a Dirichlet character that is not one at the given element.  (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 28-Apr-2016.)
statement:
dchrpt.g $e |- G = ( DChr ` N ) $.
dchrpt.z $e |- Z = ( Z/nZ ` N ) $.
dchrpt.d $e |- D = ( Base ` G ) $.
dchrpt.b $e |- B = ( Base ` Z ) $.
dchrpt.1 $e |- .1. = ( 1r ` Z ) $.
dchrpt.n $e |- ( ph -> N e. NN ) $.
dchrpt.n1 $e |- ( ph -> A =/= .1. ) $.
dchrpt.a $e |- ( ph -> A e. B ) $.
dchrpt $p |- ( ph -> E. x e. D ( x ` A ) =/= 1 ) $.
$d .1. x $.
$d A x $.
$d B x $.
$d D x $.
$d G x $.
$d N x $.
$d Z x $.
$d ph x $.
